Description: Shoulder sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior streakily glazed (fired brown); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of sphinx or siren (head, neck, and tip of wing remaining) to right; part of object on break at right; above, band at junction of shoulder and neck.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 115, no. A192)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.005) (Phase 1)
